Coastal flooding game

Setting

This game is set on a vulnerable stretch of the coast on Bald Head Island, North Carolina.

The community along this stretch of coast is protected from the ocean by a foredune, but storm surge may breach the dune and flood the homes.

Objective

Build coastal defences with your limited sand budget to save as many homes as possible from flooding.

Each round you will face larger and larger storms.

Instructions

  • Players have a limited sand budget (250g of sand total for all three rounds)
  • At the beginning of each round players will see a map of vulnerable spots where the foredune is likely to be breached
  • Then players may spend some of their sand budget to build flood defences
  • At the end of each round players will see the breaches in the dune, the simulated flooding, and the number of houses lost

Gameplay

Round 1

  • Phase 1: Players build flood defences using their sand budget
  • Phase 2: The game master breaches the dune at random vulnerable locations
  • Phase 3: The game master runs a 1m flood simulation

Round 2

  • Phase 1: Players build flood defences using their remaining sand budget
  • Phase 2: The game master breaches the dune at random vulnerable locations
  • Phase 3: The game master runs a 2m flood simulation

Round 3

  • Phase 1: Players build flood defences using their remaining sand budget
  • Phase 2: The game master breaches the dune at random vulnerable locations
  • Phase 3: The game master runs a 3m flood simulation
